title: Commission Regulation (EEC) No 59/92 of 10 January 1992 laying down a temporary provision relating to the detailed rules for the application of the subsidy system for producers of soya beans, rape seed and sunflower seed
header:
COMMISSION REGULATION (EEC) No 59/92  of 10 January 1992  laying down a temporary provision relating to the detailed rules for the application of the subsidy system for producers of soya beans, rape seed and sunflower seed
THE COMMISSION  OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body: Advance fixing  For rape seed and sunflower seed on the one hand and for soya beans on the other, the term of validity of the advance-fixing part of the certificate provided for respectively in Article 4 of Regulation (EEC) No 1594/83 and in
a of Regulation (EEC) No 2194/85 shall not extend beyond 30 June 1992, notwithstanding Article 11 (1) of Regulation (EEC) No 2681/83 and Article 13 of Regulation (EEC) No 2537/89 respectively.
Identification  No identification of rape seed, sunflower seed or soya beans may take place as from 1 July 1992.

Export refunds  For rape and sunflower seed the term of validity of export licences with advance fixing of the refund as provided for in Articled 4a of Regulation No 142/67/EEC shall not extend beyond 30 June 1992, notwithstanding Article 13  of Regulation (EEC) No 2041/75, and no exports may take place with payment of the refund as from 1 July 1992.

This Regulation shall enter into force on the third day following its publication in the Official Journal of the European Communities. This Regulation shall be binding in its entirety and directly applicable in all Member States.
